title: Marvelockg
author: Marvelockg
content: The CBN has released a statement warning the general public to be careful of the money they accept from people. The reason is that they have discovered that there are a lot of fake money in circulation and the country. As the year is coming to an end let's try and not fall victim of receiving fake money in our businesses so it won't affect our next year and it will not land us Into problem.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: If you are a seller and receiving naira, you would have seen someone paid you with fake money before. In bank, at the deposit, you will see fake money that has been perforated and attached to the wall for people to see. It has always been like that everytime. If you are not careful, or not careful enough, you would have been paid with fake money and be at a loss before you will realize. So it is not a matter of this time, but everytime.

comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: Quote from: Marvelockg on December 09, 2023, 10:02:52 AMThe CBN has released a statement warning the general public to be careful of the money they accept from people. The reason is that they have discovered that there are a lot of fake money in circulation and the country. As the year is coming to an end let's try and not fall victim of receiving fake money in our businesses so it won't affect our next year and it will not land us Into problem.This issue of counterfeit or fake money has been in existence for long and during the naira redesign a lot of scammers and fraudsters used this fake money to give to people and due to the fact that alot of people where even very incusitive for a way to get the new note made so many persons fall victims of these fake currency otherwise counterfeit. It is good to check the money that you're being given by anyone thoroughly to make sure that it isn't a counterfeit and these fake notes are more common in #500 and #1000 denominations so it is important to check some features that can be used to differentiate the original note from the fake ones features like touch quality, when you hold an original note you will find out that it has high printing quality that makes it look as if it is hard or cannot easily be teared unlike fake ones, secondly the Serial Number, Ribbon, and Gold foil.For example THE SERIAL NUMBER TEST The highlighted area is where the serial number is so when you place something like Mercury and check the black serial number it will look as if it is turning green when you check through the mercury. So if it doesn't turn green that means it's fake.THE RIBBON TESTThe Ribbon test is also another means to identify an original note just like it is being highlighted in the picture, it cut across from the top to the bottom just like broken lines with CBN inscription in it so it's also a way to check fake from original naira notes.Lastly THE GOLD FOIL TEST.Just like inscribed in the picture above, the gold foil cannot be scratched out so in a case where you scratch it out just know that it's fake. the gold foil has the Nigeria coat of arm inside it and 1000 is being written just under the gold foil.It is important to check these features thoroughly before taking the money though sometimes people can be so annoying by telling you that do you feel they're giving you counterfeit? Just disregard them and do your checking as any fake money you possess becomes irrelevant and worthless and if you're caught trying to spend it to another person then you might be apprehended by the government so prevention is better than cure.

comments.body: While we are talking about fake currency and looking at ways to identify one and safeguard ourselves from being vulnerable to these bad guys, I think fake alert is worth mentioning. This period alone two of my neighbors at the office have been victims of fake alert, one even received the alert on his phone, not knowing that it was fake alert don with some sort of an app. Fake alert is associated with heavier funds loss, especially for business owners. It is advised that you don't just get convinced when you receive alert on you phone that your money has reflected. People are now advised to always use their bank apps for confirmation, you also need to check your transaction history to see if there was any activity there. When the money is very large, I advise you do simple transactions like buying recharge cards with your app and observe you account balance to ensure that the money is there. No cautious measure is too much to safeguard yourself this Christmas period ooo. my mama dey talk am say, caution no be fear, no allow pressure from customers make you loose money. Always see electronic money transaction like P2P trading on exchanges ooo, if you no confirm well, no release your goods. na who loose guard dey collect wotoporiously.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Quote from: Marvelockg on December 09, 2023, 10:02:52 AMThe CBN has released a statement warning the general public to be careful of the money they accept from people. The reason is that they have discovered that there are a lot of fake money in circulation and the country. As the year is coming to an end let's try and not fall victim of receiving fake money in our businesses so it won't affect our next year and it will not land us Into problem.We are all vulnerable to this fake money issue as many of us can not even identify between the real money and the fake one. Even the new redesigned Naira issue alone is enough to mislead one from identify the real Naira from the fake one due to the differences and similarities bestowed on these old and new Naira notes.For someone like me, who is already used to cashless transactions even in the markets and amongst other small business, I may not be as vulnerable to this issue as someone who's a petty trader that is involved in the exchange of physical cash everyday of their business life. How such people are able to protect themselves and secure their businesses from fake money scam is not something I would know, however my advice for everyone using cash is;1. Take note of the most obvious features in the cash notes. For instance, if there is a Security Thread embedded in the cash, try and ensure if that is there and if it's a correct match.2. Try and compare the cash you are suspecting to be fake from the original ones already at your disposal to notice the similarities and the differences.3. Also observe the color and the printing quality. This is why it will difficult for us to know the originality since the major or let's say the most noticeable difference between the new Naira notes and the old notes is the color. That can easily get you confused and you won't know which is real from that which is fake.4. Also, try and check the CBN watermark that's printed on the notes, the CBN watermark is most visible when you raise the notes up to the light, so it becomes the shield between your eyes and the notes then you can see the watermark clearly.These are majorly the ways one can easily differentiate between the fake Naira notes and the original ones. But, sincerely, the government needs to invest more on the regulation of the Naira notes and the discovery and discarding of the fake notes from the public consumption.
